item.title: Report E-2024090523
item.description:
Report E-2024090523

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-26T09:22:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) quarts of material released from one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed a granular absorbent to the impacted area. The cleanup debris was containerized into one (1) 5-gallon metal pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090509
item.description:
Report E-2024090509

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-25T09:22:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior, exterior, and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the trailer and on the pavement outside and swept them up with hand tools. Crews wiped down the impacted areas with absorbent pads, hand tools, and degrease. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Tthe damaged pails of paint were collected and containerized into one (1) other 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024091409
item.description:
Report X-2024091409

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-24T09:21:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF states Regional Processing Specialist Elijah Sims was helping to unload trailer 85473 in dock door 43 when he saw a few 5 GAL pails of UN1760 Corrosive liquids, N.O.S, 8, PG I had leaked about 4 qt due to hanging off the pallet resulting in the fright to smash against the wall and bust open. ABF RPS stated that if they had loaded it correctly at the origin terminal, the freight wouldn't have rubbed up against the wall and spilled. ABF Safety advised RPS to block off the trailer until CURA has serviced it. CURA has been notified and dispatched to the terminal on emergency response. ABF advi sed RPS to send pictures to Safety.

item.title: Report E-2024090443
item.description:
Report E-2024090443

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, at 1111 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Hebron, Ohio regarding the release of STRONTIUM CHROMATE 176. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 pound of Strontium Chromate 176 (UN3077, 9, III) from (1) 1000 lb. supersack. The release was caused by a collapsed pallet and impacted a 1ft x 6ft area of the trailer floor. Contractors were able to successfully patch the hole in the punctured supersack then placed it in a lined gaylord. The release was collected with the proper PPE and placed in a metal drum. Another supersack that was undamaged but was on top of a collapsed pallet was also placed into a lined gaylord as a precaution. All cargo was unloaded, unwrapped, restacked and rewrapped onto new pallets before being reloaded onto the trailer. All waste was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DMs and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090477
item.description:
Report E-2024090477

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3066 had a loose cap and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3066-impacted trailer. The damaged pail and all impacted waste was collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums. Fifteen (15) additional pails were severely impacted and, per R+L, were palletized and gift wrapped. The waste drums and pallet of impacted pails were staged onsite for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090463
item.description:
Report E-2024090463

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 01:33 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCO. It was reported that approximately a quarter of a gallon of UN1263 Master Pro Refinishing Metal Strip released from a metal can due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted inside of trailer #3212046. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The damaged metal can and clean up debris were containerized into a 20-gallon drum, which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2024091114

  • City: MIAMISBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/10/2024 at apporximately 1630, Dangerous Goods Administraton received a call from Employee 3836150 at the station location in Miamisburg, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic jerrican, packaged in a fiberboard box. Due to human error, the shipment spilled from the closure. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits either an amended shipper's declaration or a customer pick-up.

item.title: Report E-2024090414
item.description:
Report E-2024090414

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: AKRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 9, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of organic peroxide had a damaged cap and released approximately two (2) ounces to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed absorbent rags to the impacted drum, and neutralized the exterior. A replacement cap was then used to fix the drum. The drum was staged on the truck for future shipping. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon vented drum and was taken to the Columbiana terminal for future disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: During the process of loading freight into the trailer where the tote was already loaded, a protruding piece of wood from a broken pallet punctured the tote. The IBC container was immediately contained to reduce further release. The released material was neutralized, absorbed and containerized for proper disposal.
